00022 /*
00023     The global object JSON contains two methods.
00024 
00025     JSON.stringify(value) takes a JavaScript value and produces a JSON text.
00026     The value must not be cyclical.
00027 
00028     JSON.parse(text) takes a JSON text and produces a JavaScript value. It will
00029     return false if there is an error.
00030 */
00031 
00032 
00043 W.json = function () {
00044     var m = {
00045             '\b': '\\b',
00046             '\t': '\\t',
00047             '\n': '\\n',
00048             '\f': '\\f',
00049             '\r': '\\r',
00050             '"' : '\\"',
00051             '\\': '\\\\'
00052         },
00053         s = {
00054             'boolean': function (x) {
00055                 return String(x);
00056             },
00057             number: function (x) {
00058                 return isFinite(x) ? String(x) : 'null';
00059             },
00060             string: function (x) {
00061                 if (/["\\\x00-\x1f]/.test(x)) {
00062                     x = x.replace(/([\x00-\x1f\\"])/g, function(a, b) {
00063                         var c = m[b];
00064                         if (c) {
00065                             return c;
00066                         }
00067                         c = b.charCodeAt();
00068                         return '\\u00' +
00069                             Math.floor(c / 16).toString(16) +
00070                             (c % 16).toString(16);
00071                     });
00072                 }
00073                 return '"' + x + '"';
00074             },
00075             object: function (x) {
00076                 if (x) {
00077                     var a = [], b, f, i, l, v;
00078                     if (x instanceof Array) {
00079                         a[0] = '[';
00080                         l = x.length;
00081                         for (i = 0; i < l; i += 1) {
00082                             v = x[i];
00083                             f = s[typeof v];
00084                             if (f) {
00085                                 v = f(v);
00086                                 if (typeof v == 'string') {
00087                                     if (b) {
00088                                         a[a.length] = ',';
00089                                     }
00090                                     a[a.length] = v;
00091                                     b = true;
00092                                 }
00093                             }
00094                         }
00095                         a[a.length] = ']';
00096                     } else if (typeof x.hasOwnProperty === 'function') {
00097                         a[0] = '{';
00098                         for (i in x) {
00099                             if (x.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
00100                                 v = x[i];
00101                                 f = s[typeof v];
00102                                 if (f) {
00103                                     v = f(v);
00104                                     if (typeof v == 'string') {
00105                                         if (b) {
00106                                             a[a.length] = ',';
00107                                         }
00108                                         a.push(s.string(i), ':', v);
00109                                         b = true;
00110                                     }
00111                                 }
00112                             }
00113                         }
00114                         a[a.length] = '}';
00115                     } else if(typeof x == 'object') {
00116                         a[a.length] = W.json.stringify(x);
00117                     } else {
00118                         return;
00119                     }
00120                     return a.join('');
00121                 }
00122                 return 'null';
00123             }
00124         };
00125     return {
00126         copyright: '(c)2005 JSON.org',
00127         license: 'http://www.JSON.org/license.html',
00128 /*
00129     Stringify a JavaScript value, producing a JSON text.
00130 */
00131         stringify: function (v) {
00132             var f = s[typeof v];
00133             if (f) {
00134                 v = f(v);
00135                 if (typeof v == 'string') {
00136                     return v;
00137                 }
00138             }
00139             return null;
00140         },
00141 /*
00142     Parse a JSON text, producing a JavaScript value.
00143     It returns false if there is a syntax error.
00144 */
00145         parse: function (text) {
00146             try {
00147                 return !(/[^,:{}\[\]0-9.\-+Eaeflnr-u \n\r\t]/.test(
00148                         text.replace(/"(\\.|[^"\\])*"/g, ''))) &&
00149                     eval('(' + text + ')');
00150             } catch (e) {
00151                 return false;
00152             }
00153         }
00154     };
00155 }();
